{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569138,"name":"Eric Liefeld","username":"etbarbaric","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T16:08:53.862Z","cooked":"

We are experiencing an odd discrepancy between on-the-fly paths and PathPlanner-designed paths. Specifically, when given the same targetPose, the robot is ending in a distinctly different spot (off by as much as a foot).

We suspect that we may be seeing some discrepancy in field mapping between WPIlib/PathPlannerlib and the PathPlanner app, but can’t put our finger on it.

FWIW, our on-the-fly paths are accurate while the PathPlanner paths are not.

Any suggestions greatly appreciated.

Eric - Team #1164 - Project NEO

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T16:26:04.301Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":76.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496995,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-issue-pathplanner-paths-vs-on-the-fly-paths","display_username":"Eric Liefeld","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37086,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-issue-pathplanner-paths-vs-on-the-fly-paths/496995/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569564,"name":"Alexander Carlisi","username":"AlexanderCarlisi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alexandercarlisi/{size}/255089_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T21:45:28.180Z","cooked":"

PathPlanner is using your Pose Estimate that you feed it. Since your on-the-fly pathing is correct I would suspect an mis-configured AutoBuilder.

If you don’t believe that I be the case, please send a link to your code repo.

Interesting… and entirely possible. Code is here. Branch is ScoreSystem. Autobuilder is in SwerveSubsystem.java.

Could it be related to the initial pose passed to the Pose Estimator being uninitialized? PathPlanner paths do work, they just overshoot the targetPose.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T22:10:30.967Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496995,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-issue-pathplanner-paths-vs-on-the-fly-paths","display_username":"Eric Liefeld","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":37086,"username":"etbarbaric","name":"Eric Liefeld","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ba8739/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37086,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-issue-pathplanner-paths-vs-on-the-fly-paths/496995/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569590,"name":"Alexander Carlisi","username":"AlexanderCarlisi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alexandercarlisi/{size}/255089_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T22:14:44.438Z","cooked":"

I see you use Autobuilder for your on the fly pathing, so I’m gonna say that it should be configured properly, and it looked perfect too.

Your idea about your initial position being off could be correct, I would suggest implementing some logging for the Auto, check the Initial Pose, and target Pose.

It’s very possible that your robot just thought it was at the right spot for a moment, or it knows it isn’t at the right spot, in which you have a deeper issue.

Edit: when checking the logs look at everything (Vision Pose Estimates, Odometry, and PathPlanners current pose and trajectories)
